intro: Caesia dichotomizans, commonly known as the dichotomous caesia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in open woodlands. Its flowers are usually pink or lavender in color and are arranged in dense, terminal spikes. Caesia dichotomizans is often found in wetland habitats and is adapted to periodic flooding.
